con:testCase.name: Reuse Groovy Selenium Steps
con:testCase.con:description:
Copy these steps to construct a sequence using selenium session across test steps
Always use sequence: StartDriver ... your steps StopDriver
This can only be run as a test case and not as individual steps

con:testCase.name: UploadTestFileAndAuthorize
con:testCase.con:description: Uploads test usage file and authorizes it

con:testCase.name: Create Authorization and extract all information

con:testStep.name: branch based on need to authorize
Verify DC scope section URI present

con:config.script: context.mockService = testRunner.testCase.testSuite.project.getRestMockServiceByName("ThirdParty Authorization Mock Service"); context.mockService.setPropertyValue("tokenResponse",""); context.mockService.setPropertyValue("authorizationServerAuthorizationEndpoint",testRunner.testCase.getPropertyValue("authorizationServerAuthorizationEndpoint")); context.mockService.setPropertyValue("redirect_uri",testRunner.testCase.getPropertyValue("redirect_uri")); context.mockService.setPropertyValue("authorizationServerTokenEndpoint",testRunner.testCase.getPropertyValue("authorizationServerTokenEndpoint")); def runner = context.mockService.start(); context.mockRunner = runner; return;

con:testStep.name: Script will bring up browser to DC Scope selection screen
Wait for Authorization to Complete and End Browser session

con:config.script: context.mockRunner.stop(); return;

con:testStep.name: Validate and extract information from authorization
testType1_RestVerbs after ROOT Posts (link UP after POST)
testType1_RestVerbs after ROOT Posts (link UP before POST)
testType1_RestVerbs after ROOT Posts (POST UP via XPATH)
Scenario: Retail Customer authorizes Usage Points access (reg UP before upload)
Scenario: Retail Customer authorizes Usage Points access
Scenario: Retail Customer views Usage Points with Meter Readings
Scenario: Retail Customer authorizes Scope from Data Custodian
Scenario: Retail Customer denies Scope from Data Custodian
Scenario: Data Custodian notifies Third Party of updated Subscription
Scenario: Third Party customer accesses Authorizations page
Scenario: Retail Customer views Data Custodian list
Scenario: Retail Customer selects Data Custodian for the list
Scenario: Retail Customer authorizes Third Party
GET Authorization - third_party_access of User Authorization Subscription 6

con:restRequest.name: [NEG] GET Authorization - third_party_access of User Authorization for DC

con:testStep.name: Feature: Third Party User Subscription API

con:testSuite.name: Green Button Connect My Data
con:testSuite.con:description:
This test suite collects GBCMD tests by function block.
It is currently a limited starting point with a lot of detail to be added.

con:testCase.name: [FB_3] Core Green Button Connect My Data

con:configuration.path: declare namespace espi="http://naesb.org/espi" declare namespace ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" count(/ns3:feed/ns3:entry/ns3:content/espi:Authorization)

con:testStep.name: [TR_TC001] Test software shall issue a service request over an SSL session and shall verify that the response HTTP header contains the following fields and information.

con:config.name: [TR_TC001] Test software shall issue a service request over an SSL session and shall verify that the response HTTP header contains the following fields and information.

con:testStep.name: [TR_TC003] Verify that the Data Custodian implements TLS 1.2
[TR_TC004] Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer or Third Party the Data Custodian negotiates the highest level of TLS mutually supported.
[TR_TC005] Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer the Data Custodian rejects TLS_RSA_WITH_NULL_SHA cipher suites.
[TR_TC006] Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer at a minimum the Data Custodian accepts the TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA cipher suite.
[TR_TC008] Verify that the Data Custodian maintains an unexpired unrevoked RSA certificate with a public key length of at least 2048 bits.
[TR_TC013] Verify that the Third Party implements TLS 1.1 or higher.
[TR_TC014] Verify that when communicating with a Data Custodian or Retail Customer the Third Party negotiates the highest level of TLS mutually supported
[TR_TC016] Verify that the Third Party maintains an unexpired unrevoked RSA certificate with a public key length of at least 2048 bits
Scenario: Retail Customer views Data Custodian list
Scenario: Retail Customer selects Data Custodian for the list
Scenario: Retail Customer authorizes Third Party

con:testCase.name: Emulate DC Send notification Authorization B

con:config.script: context.testCase.getTestStepAt(1).testRequest.requestHeaders.set("Accept", "test") /* def headers = request.requestHeaders 2. headers.put( "X-tokenHeader", "value" ) 3. request.requestHeaders = headers */

con:assertion.name: dataCustodianApplicationStatus must contain a value of 1,2,3 or 4
token_endpoint_auth_method must contain the value client_secret_basic
grant_types must contain a value of authorization_code, refresh_token or client_credentials
if grant_types=client_credentials then redirect_uri should not be present or should contain a null value. Otherwise redirect_uri must be present.

con:assertion.name: dataCustodianApplicationStatus must contain a value of 1,2,3 or 4
token_endpoint_auth_method must contain the value client_secret_basic
grant_types must contain a value of authorization_code, refresh_token or client_credentials
if grant_types=client_credentials then redirect_uri should not be present or should contain a null value. Otherwise redirect_uri must be present.

con:testSuite.name: [FB_13] Security and Privacy

con:testCase.name: TC001 Use of HTTPS
con:testCase.con:description: Verify the Data Custodian under test response HTTP header contains field indicating establishment of a secure session.

con:testCase.name: TC003 Data Custodian implements TLS 1.2
con:testCase.con:description: Verify the Data Custodian under test implements TLS 1.2.

con:testStep.name: Verify support for TLS 1.2 using OpenSSL

con:testCase.name: TC004 Negotiate highest level of TLS with browser
con:testCase.con:description: Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer the Data Custodian negotiates the highest level of TLS supported by both parties.

con:testStep.name: Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer or Third Party the Data Custodian negotiates the highest level of TLS mutually supported.

con:testCase.name: TC005 Reject TLS_RSA_WITH_NULL_SHA cipher suite
con:testCase.con:description: Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer the Data Custodian rejects TLS_RSA_WITH_NULL_SHA cipher suites.

con:testCase.name: TC006 Accept TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA cipher suite
con:testCase.con:description: Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer at a minimum the Data Custodian accepts the TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA cipher suite.

con:testCase.name: TC008 Quality of Certificate
con:testCase.con:description: Verify that the Data Custodian maintains an unexpired unrevoked RSA certificate with a public key length of at least 2048 bits.

con:testCase.name: TC009 Root of trust
con:testCase.con:description: Test software or manual inspection shall verify that the Data Custodian RSA certificate was issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that has been successfully audited according to the criteria of ETSI or WebTrust.

con:testCase.name: TC010 Tokens and IDs have no PII
con:testCase.con:description: Test software or manual inspection shall verify that Tokens and IDs communicated by the Data Custodian are opaque and if based on actual Customer information that they are randomized using a secure method to protect privacy.

con:testStep.name: Tokens and IDs have no PII

con:testCase.name: TC011 Tokens and IDs have at least 48bits
con:testCase.con:description: Test software or manual inspection shall verify that Tokens and IDs communicated by the Data Custodian consist of at least 48 bits and can be the random number part of an RFC2422 UUID.

con:testCase.name: TC012 FIPS 140-2 support
con:testCase.con:description: Manual inspection of supporting documentation shall confirm that the Data Custodian implementation utilizes software libraries which are FIPS 140-2 level 1 or higher and listed on the CMVP website.

Script will bring up browser to DC Scope selection screen
Perform Login
con:testStep.con:description:
Please login to the Data Custodian under test and wait for the Thid Party Scope Selection Screen.
When this screen appears please right click on the page and select "Page Info" from the conext menu.
Choose the Security tab click the view cookies button and copy the session cookie for the Data Custodian path.
Paste this session cookie into the "Result" field of this dialog box.

Choose the Security tab click the view cookies button and copy the session cookie for the Data Custodian path.



Paste this session cookie into the "Result" field of this dialog box.



After this step is complete:



Please select a scope for testing and submit.
